comments.message:
Patch Set 2:

(4 comments)

I skipped all of the amd, scsi, and nvme changes.
Uploaded patch set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased.
Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.
Uploaded patch set 6: Commit message was updated.

Patch Set 6: Integration-Approval-1

Sorry, I missed a compiler nit under DEBUG

Patch Set 7: -Integration-Approval

Sorry for missing this and causing an extra round trip.
I've retested with the updated bits (including DEBUG)
Uploaded patch set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased.
Uploaded patch set 9: Commit message was updated.
Change has been successfully merged by Patrick Mooney
All functions in iov.c are only called by pci_virtio_scsi.c so there's no need to build it now.

On the assumption that we may one day get the issues sorted out that prevent us from building virtio_scsi now, I'd like to keep iov.c in the build so we know it's functional.  The cost of keeping it there is low.
why is it safe for us to ignore the return value while FreeBSD has become more paranoid about it?  We don't ignore the return in earlier calls.
Not necessary now that the strdup() is gone?
Duh, misread that while looking at diffs then came here to add comment.
